title: 'Nice guys do win' - why losing a semi-final to New Zealand isn't all bad
description: England suffered the heartbreak of losing a T20 World Cup semi-final - but at least the nice guys won it.

title: 'Wilson' volleyball head from Cast Away film sold for $308,000
description: The iconic film prop was Tom Hanks' only companion in the Oscar-nominated 2000 film Cast Away.

title: Time-lapse video shows Iceland glacier shrink
description: Footage shows the rapid rate that centuries-old ice from the Breiðamerkurjökull glacier is melting.

title: La Palma: Second lava stream reaches ocean
description: The molten rock could join up with an existing delta made from solidified molten rock.

title: My Day at COP26: 'I'm painting murals so people don't forget COP happened here'
description: Daniel Rupaszov, from Hungary, is an artist and activist who visits COP every year to create art which highlights the climate crisis.

title: 'Written off' Australia ready for unbeaten Pakistan in T20 World Cup semi
description: Australia continue their bid for the Men's T20 World Cup - the only trophy that has eluded them - against an unbeaten Pakistan in the semi-final in Dubai.

title: Huma Abedin: Hillary Clinton aide on laptop that may have lost the election
description: The FBI reinvestigated Hillary Clinton's emails after seizing a laptop from Huma Abedin's then-husband.

title: Horse trading set to begin over agreement at COP26
description: The release of a draft text for the COP26 agreement signals the start of serious negotiations.

title: M&S profits surge as food aids Covid bounce back
description: Shares in the High Street giant soar 20% on a sales rebound as recovery from Covid restrictions continues.

title: COP26: Draft deal calls for stronger carbon cutting targets by end of 2022
description: The document says vulnerable nations must get more help to cope with the deadly impacts of global warming.

title: Uncapped Sale prop Rodd called into England squad to replace Marler
description: Bevan Rodd, who also qualifies for Scotland, replaces Joe Marler in England's squad for Saturday's Test against Australia.

title: Geoffrey Cox: Labour calls for probe into MP's work for British Virgin Islands
description: A clip appears to show the Conservative using his MP's office to work for the British Virgin Islands.

title: Brecon Beacons: George Linnane named as rescued caver
description: George Linnane was brought to the surface after he was stranded in a cave system for two days.

title: Japan train driver sues over 49 cents in docked wages
description: The tiny sum was docked after the man caused a one-minute delay to Japan's punctual train system.

title: Supreme Court blocks mass iPhone claim against Google
description: The claim sought damages for millions of iPhone users who were tracked by Google.

title: NI civil rights leader Austin Currie dies
description: One of the founding members of the SDLP, he was elected to parliament on both sides of the Irish border.

title: Bella Hadid: 'I've had breakdowns and burnouts'
description: The supermodel posts tearful photos and says she wants others struggling to know "you're not alone".

title: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern's live stream interrupted by three-year-old daughter
description: Three-year-old Neve interrupted Jacinda Ardern's Facebook Live on Covid restrictions.

title: Afghanistan's ghost soldiers undermined fight against Taliban - ex-official
description: Thousands of troops who were supposed to fight the Taliban did not exist, a former minister says.

title: Rangers boss Gerrard favourite for vacant Villa job
description: Aston Villa are yet to make a formal approach to Rangers for manager Steven Gerrard but he remains the favourite to succeed Dean Smith.

title: Carer shortage leaves Greysteel woman 'stuck in hospital'
description: Brenda Devine, from Greysteel, has not been able to go home for months due to a shortage of carers.

title: The extraordinary story of how 300 volunteers rescued a stranded caver
description: One of the UK's longest cave rescue operations has ended safely after 250 volunteers came together from across the country.

title: Nasa's Orion spacecraft: A guide
description: A guide to the spaceship that will carry astronauts back to the Moon this decade.

title: Nasa's Moon return pushed back to 2025
description: The first Nasa mission to return to the surface of the Moon has been delayed by one year to 2025.

title: Wetherspoons: Cocktail sales up but ales out, says pub chain
description: It said that younger customers were driving sales of cocktails, vodka and rum in the last 15 weeks.

title: River Thames: Sharks and seahorses found living in waterway
description: A report highlights changes since the river was declared "biologically dead" in 1957.

title: COP26: PM’s summit plea and axing trees to save water
description: Five things you need to know about COP26 - the United Nations climate change conference - on Wednesday.

title: World Cup 2022 qualifying: Who needs what to reach Qatar?
description: England should confirm their World Cup place this month, while Scotland and Wales are hoping for the play-offs. Who needs what?

title: 'I ran downstairs and told my mum' - Smith Rowe on surprise England call-up
description: Arsenal forward Emile Smith Rowe says his first call-up to the full England squad was "a great moment for me and my family".

title: The Papers: Race to jab the NHS and MP accused of rule breach
description: The papers cover the vaccine mandate for health workers and more concerns over MPs' second jobs.

title: Apple's original computer fetches $400,000 at US auction

title: Astronauts return to Earth on SpaceX capsule
description: The astronauts spent 200 days in orbit on the International Space Station.

title: Erin Pizzey: The woman who looked beyond the bruises

title: Lace-maker who made Kate’s wedding dress retires
